channel.title: Need help declaring something
channel.description:
I'm trying to add d claws on my 317 delta based server. I did add them, but i get 8 errors.
client.java:15517: cannot find symbol symbol : variable dclaws location: class client if(dclaws == 3) { ^ client.java:15518: cannot find symbol symbol : method dclawed() location: class client dclawed(); ^ client.java:15521: cannot find symbol symbol : variable dclaws location: class client if(dclaws == 2) { ^ client.java:15523: cannot find symbol symbol : method dclawed2() location: class client dclawed2(); ^ client.java:15526: cannot find symbol symbol : variable dclaws location: class client if(dclaws == 1) { ^ client.java:15527: cannot find symbol symbol : method dclawed2() location: class client dclawed2(); ^ client.java:15531: cannot find symbol symbol : variable dclaws location: class client if(dclaws > 0) { ^ client.java:15532: cannot find symbol symbol : variable dclaws location: class client dclaws -= 1; ^ 8 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
I was told i need to declare "dclaws". Idk how to do that though. i'm still a nooby coder. If anyone can help, plz reply! Thanks.

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.description:
@411 wrote:

I’m confused as well, on how to write a method. I’m a really nooby coder whos still trying to learn the basics lol, if anyone can help me write these, ill rep++. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.dc:creator: @zoomer zoomer
item.description:
@zoomer wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:5, topic:408025”] public int dclaws; 

	public void dclawed() {

	}

	public void dclawed2() {

	}

You’ll have to write the method’s and such your self.[/quote]

Wouldn’t he declare those in player.java though? Just confused =\

Read full topic

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

public int dclaws;
	public void dclawed() {

	}

	public void dclawed2() {

	}

You’ll have to write the method’s and such your self.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.description:
@411 wrote:

there supposed to be a fix, for the d claw spec, so it will hit 4times, instead of 2.

EDIT: i declared those 3 methods, and now i have 2 errors.

client.java:29: missing method body, or declare abstract
public int dclawed();
^
client.java:30: missing method body, or declare abstract
public int dclawed2();
^
2 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

How do i go about fixing these? i’m clueless.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

It also looks as if you need to declare both “dclawed()” and “dclawed2()” as methods in that class. What is the function of those methods?

Read full topic

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

public int dclaws;

item.title: Need help declaring something
item.description:
@411 wrote:

I’m trying to add d claws on my 317 delta based server. I did add them, but i get 8 errors.

client.java:15517: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable dclaws
location: class client
if(dclaws == 3) {
^
client.java:15518: cannot find symbol
symbol : method dclawed()
location: class client
dclawed();
^
client.java:15521: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable dclaws
location: class client
if(dclaws == 2) {
^
client.java:15523: cannot find symbol
symbol : method dclawed2()
location: class client
dclawed2();
^
client.java:15526: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable dclaws
location: class client
if(dclaws == 1) {
^
client.java:15527: cannot find symbol
symbol : method dclawed2()
location: class client
dclawed2();
^
client.java:15531: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable dclaws
location: class client
if(dclaws > 0) {
^
client.java:15532: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable dclaws
location: class client
dclaws -= 1;
^
8 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

I was told i need to declare “dclaws”. Idk how to do that though. i’m still a nooby coder. If anyone can help, plz reply! Thanks.

Read full topic
